title: Cardano Hackathon
description: Exposing outside developers and innovators to Cardano through a hackathon would bring fresh insight to the current ecosystem.

assessments.note: The proposal will bring interest from blockchain developers to the cardano ecosystem which may convert into new proposals being generated on ideascale.

The proposer is seeking to host a Hackathon to attract attention of potential developers who would partake in project Catalyst. This has the potential to reach results in fund 6 with the right marketing strategy.

Hackathons are events with the potential to attract developers and entrepreneurs from outside the Cardano ecosystem, so I believe it addresses the challenge, but there is no plan described and no metrics, this makes it difficult to measure the impact on the challenge.

A hackathon could potentially bring new people to Catalyst. So the idea itself is within the challenge setting. However, the proposer provides just a few information overall and there is no statement about specifically attract entrepreneurs to Catalyst.
The team states that they have organized a hackathon before however no examples were provided.

The proposer claims to have experience organizing hackathons but does not provide any details to back up their claim. Given they have experience in this area, they will be able to implement their plan independently.

There is no plan outlined. The proposer reported experience with organizing hackathons, but cited none of these hackathons, there are also no details about his professional experiences or qualifications.

I recommendthe  inclusion of more information.
The proposer does not provide evidence about relevant experience. Related comments remain unanswered. The description is not very detailed. It is just a blank idea without any workable plan.
the proposal doesn't include details on how many potential proposals they might gain via hackathon.
The proposal does not provide any detailed information on approximate timeline or budget breakdown to achieve minimum desired results.

A Hackathon has the potential to address the challenge, but as there is no plan in the description there is no way to assess the chances of a real impact on the challenge. I recommend that the proposer detail the proposal according to the Catalyst guidelines and documentation.

The proposer does not provide KPIs or a timeline and also no roadmap to assess his doing. For a future proposal I suggest to provide sufficient information about the goals: how many participants in the hackathon, how many new participants on catalyst? And also provide a clear plan: For what will the budget be spent? Where/When does the event take place? etc.

Yes, we should have more hackathons but not sure why this team should organize them.

There have been Hackathons before:
https://cryptoslate.com/iohk-rolls-out-marlowe-playground-and-announces-winners-of-10000-cardano-hackathon/

And they have been suggested before:
https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Goguen-Launch-Global-Hackathon/334438-48088
This proposal is empty and includes none of the basic information required.
The problem and solution statement presented addresses the challenge directly, but there are few details about the organization of the Hackathon so that we can understand its impact on the challenge.

I like the idea of hackathons because they can bring enormous value to the ecosystem. However, this proposal reads more like a concept and it doesn't go into greater depth of how exactly this could be done and where it fits within the cardano narrative. Few more considerations would need to be made in order to effectively understand this specific proposal. Potentially, some gain - but not at this stage, I am afraid.
Unclear who the team is and what their competence is.
Beyond the relevant experience their is nothing in this proposal that describes how this Hackathon will be implemented, who it will target, where or when.

The described plan is extremely simple, it lacks details. There are no details about the proposer / team experience. I recommend that the proposal be more detailed according to the guidelines and documentation of Catalyst, moreover it is essential that more information about the expertise of the proposer / team is presented, if the team has already organized hackathons it is important that examples are presented.

Being it just a concept - there is no indication of sensible plan just yet or explanation of budget semantics. There just isn't enough information to go by and effectively judge the merits. Needs more work.
Unclear. Would the 30,000 USD be price money or how would that be used?
This is a very incomplete proposal.

There is not enough information to indicate the feasibility of the proposal, the plan presented is very simple, there is no roadmap, milestones, KPIS, details about the proposer / team and details about the budget allocation. I recommend including this information in accordance with the Catalyst guidelines and documentation.

AS a concept goes - it lacks roadmap, milestones, KPIs, challenges/risks, and other basic considerations that would help community examine validity of this proposal. It isn't investable at the moment. Mentorship program out of catalyst discord could be one of way how to address that issue.

solution: Hosting a Cardano based hackathon would encourage developers to explore and experiment with the space.
experience: Our team has previously organized hackathons.
